option.value: {"C:/Users/Geschäftskonto/Desktop/Studentensytem-Rep":"{\"/studentsystem/src/main/java/com/canama/studentsystem/repository/StudentRepository.java\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. Instead, it defines a repository interface named `StudentRepository` that extends the `JpaRepository` interface provided by Spring Data JPA.\\n\\nThe `StudentRepository` interface is responsible for providing CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations for the `Student` entity. It allows you to perform database operations on the `Student` entity without having to write the boilerplate code for these operations.\\n\\nBy extending the `JpaRepository` interface, the `StudentRepository` inherits a set of predefined methods that can be used to interact with the database, such as `save()`, `findById()`, `findAll()`, `delete()`, and more.\",\"/chat/src/main/java/com/canama/websocket/chat/ChatApplication.java\":\"This file is the main class for a Spring Boot application that provides a WebSocket-based chat functionality.\\n\\n`ChatApplication`: This is the main class that bootstraps the Spring Boot application and starts the chat application.\\n\\n`main(String[] args)`: This is the main entry point of the application, which runs the `SpringApplication.run()` method to start the application.\",\"/studentsystem/src/main/java/com/canama/studentsystem/Entity/Student.java\":\"This file defines a `Student` class, which represents a student in a student management system. The class is configured as a JPA entity and uses Lombok annotations to generate boilerplate code.\\n\\n`Student`: Represents a student in a student management system, with properties such as name, address, and a list of courses the student is enrolled in.\\n\\nThe file does not contain any functions, but it defines the following properties and relationships for the `Student` class:\\n\\n- `id`: The unique identifier of the student, automatically generated by the database.\\n- `name`: The name of the student.\\n- `address`: The address of the student.\\n- `courses`: A list of courses the student is enrolled in, represented as a many-to-many relationship with the `Course` class.\\n\\nThe file also includes Javadoc comments that provide a detailed description of the `Student` class and its properties.\",\"/studentfrontend/src/index.js\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. Instead, it sets up the React application by rendering the `App` component within the `React.StrictMode` component, which is then mounted to the DOM element with the ID of `root`.\\n\\nThe file performs the following tasks:\\n\\n1. Imports the necessary React and ReactDOM modules.\\n2. Imports the CSS file `index.css`.\\n3. Imports the `App` component from the `App.js` file.\\n4. Creates a root instance using `ReactDOM.createRoot()` and mounts the `App` component within the `React.StrictMode` component to the DOM element with the ID of `root`.\",\"/studentsystem/src/main/java/com/canama/studentsystem/DTO/StudentDto.java\":\"This file contains a single class:\\n\\n`StudentDto`: A data transfer object (DTO) that represents a student, including their ID, name, address, and a list of courses they are enrolled in.\\n\\nThis file does not contain any functions. It is a simple DTO class that is used to transfer student data between different parts of the application.\",\"/studentfrontend/public/manifest.json\":\"This file appears to be a JSON configuration file for a React application. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather defines the metadata and configuration settings for the application. Here\\u0027s a summary of the key elements in the file:\\n\\n`\\\"short_name\\\"`: Provides a short name for the application.\\n`\\\"name\\\"`: Provides a longer, more descriptive name for the application.\\n`\\\"icons\\\"`: Defines the various icons to be used for the application, including a favicon and two larger icons for different screen sizes.\\n`\\\"start_url\\\"`: Specifies the starting URL for the application.\\n`\\\"display\\\"`: Indicates that the application should be displayed in standalone mode.\\n`\\\"theme_color\\\"`: Defines the primary color theme for the application.\\n`\\\"background_color\\\"`: Defines the background color for the application.\\n\\nThis file is typically used by a web server or a web browser to provide information about the application, such as its name, icons, and display settings, which can be used to create a more seamless and integrated user experience.\",\"/studentsystem/src/main/java/com/canama/studentsystem/service/StudentService.java\":\"This file defines an interface called `StudentService` that provides methods for managing student data in a student management system.\\n\\n`StudentService`: An interface that defines the contract for managing student data in the student management system.\\n\\n`saveStudent(Student student)`: A method that saves a new student record to the database.\\n\\n`getAllStudents()`: A method that retrieves a list of all students from the database.\\n\\n`deleteStudentById(Integer id)`: A method that deletes a student record from the database based on the provided student ID.\",\"/studentfrontend/src/index.css\":\"This file appears to be a CSS stylesheet that defines the styles for a chat application. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather defines the styles for various elements of the chat interface, such as the registration form, the chat box, the member list, the chat messages, and the message input field. The styles include layout, typography, colors, and other visual properties to create a visually appealing and functional chat interface.\",\"/chat/src/test/java/com/canama/websocket/chat/ChatApplicationTests.java\":\"This file appears to be a test class for a Spring Boot application. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather a single test method that checks if the application context loads successfully.\\n\\n`ChatApplicationTests`: A test class that verifies the successful loading of the Spring Boot application context.\\n\\n`contextLoads()`: A test method that checks if the Spring Boot application context can be loaded without any issues.\",\"/studentsystem/src/main/java/com/canama/studentsystem/Entity/Course.java\":\"This file defines a `Course` entity class for a student management system. The class is configured as a JPA (Java Persistence API) entity and uses Lombok to generate boilerplate code. The `Course` class represents a course that can be taken by multiple students, and it has a many-to-many relationship with the `Student` entity.\\n\\n`Course`: Represents a course in a student management system, with an ID, name, description, and a list of students enrolled in the course.\\n\\n`id`: The unique identifier for the course, automatically generated by the database.\\n\\n`name`: The name of the course.\\n\\n`description`: An optional description of the course.\\n\\n`students`: A list of students enrolled in the course, with a many-to-many relationship.\",\"/studentfrontend/src/components/ChatRoom.js\":\"This file is a React component that implements a chat room functionality. It uses the SockJS and STOMP libraries to establish a WebSocket connection with a server and handle real-time messaging. The component allows users to join a public chat room, send messages, and also engage in private conversations with other users. The file does not contain any classes, but it has the following functions:\\n\\n`connect`: Establishes a WebSocket connection with the server.\\n`onConnected`: Handles the successful connection to the server and subscribes to the necessary channels.\\n`userJoin`: Sends a message to the server indicating that a user has joined the chat room.\\n`onMessageReceived`: Handles the reception of messages from the public chat room and updates the state accordingly.\\n`onPrivateMessage`: Handles the reception of private messages and updates the state accordingly.\\n`onError`: Handles any errors that occur during the WebSocket connection.\\n`handleMessage`: Updates the state with the user\\u0027s message input.\\n`sendValue`: Sends a message to the public chat room.\\n`sendPrivateValue`: Sends a private message to a specific user.\\n`handleUsername`: Updates the state with the user\\u0027s username.\\n`registerUser`: Initiates the WebSocket connection and the user\\u0027s registration.\",\"/chat/src/main/java/com/canama/websocket/chat/config/WebsocketConfig.java\":\"This file is a Spring configuration class for a WebSocket-based chat application.\\n\\n`WebsocketConfig`: This class configures the WebSocket message broker and endpoint for the chat application.\\n\\n`registerStompEndpoints`: This function registers the WebSocket endpoint \\\"/ws\\\" and allows connections from any origin using SockJS.\\n\\n`configureMessageBroker`: This function sets the application destination prefix to \\\"/app\\\", enables a simple message broker for the \\\"/chatroom\\\" and \\\"/user\\\" destinations, and sets the user destination prefix to \\\"/user\\\".\",\"/studentsystem/src/main/java/com/canama/studentsystem/repository/CourseRepository.java\":\"This file contains a single interface named `CourseRepository` that extends the `JpaRepository` interface provided by Spring Data JPA.\\n\\n`CourseRepository`: This interface provides a set of CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations for the `Course` entity.\\n\\nThe file does not contain any classes or functions. It defines a repository interface that allows interacting with the `Course` entity in the database using the Spring Data JPA framework.\",\"/studentfrontend/src/components/Appbar.js\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following functions:\\n\\n`Appbar`: This function creates a responsive app bar with a menu icon that opens a dropdown menu with links to different pages of the application.\\n\\n`handleMenuOpen`: This function sets the `anchorEl` state to the current target element, which opens the dropdown menu.\\n\\n`handleMenuClose`: This function sets the `anchorEl` state to `null`, which closes the dropdown menu.\\n\\nThis file is a React component that provides a reusable app bar with a menu for navigating to different pages of a Spring Boot React Fullstack Application.\",\"/studentfrontend/package-lock.json\":\"This file appears to be a configuration file for a React project. It does not contain any classes or functions. The file defines the dependencies, devDependencies, and other configuration settings for the project.\",\"/studentsystem/src/main/java/com/canama/studentsystem/controller/StudentController.java\":\"This file contains a Spring Boot REST controller called `StudentController` that handles HTTP requests related to student management. The controller provides the following functionality:\\n\\n`StudentController`: A REST controller that handles HTTP requests related to student management.\\n\\n`add(Student student)`: Adds a new student to the system, ensuring that the associated courses exist in the database.\\n\\n`getAllStudents()`: Returns a list of all students.\\n\\n`deleteStudent(Integer id)`: Deletes a student by their ID.\\n\\n`updateStudentCourses(Integer id, List\\u003cMap\\u003cString, Integer\\u003e\\u003e coursesData)`: Updates the courses associated with a student by their ID.\",\"/studentfrontend/src/components/Course.js\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following functions:\\n\\n`fetchCourses`: Fetches the list of courses from the backend and updates the state.\\n\\n`handleClick`: Handles the addition of a new course by validating the input, sending a POST request to the backend, and updating the list of courses.\\n\\n`handleDelete`: Handles the deletion of a course by sending a DELETE request to the backend and updating the list of courses.\\n\\nThe file is a React component that provides a user interface for managing courses. It allows users to add new courses, display the list of courses, and delete courses. The component also includes error and success notifications using Material-UI\\u0027s Snackbar component.\",\"/studentsystem/src/main/java/com/canama/studentsystem/StudentsystemApplication.java\":\"This file is the main class for a Spring Boot application called \\\"StudentsystemApplication\\\". It does not contain any other classes or functions. The main purpose of this file is to bootstrap the Spring Boot application and start the application\\u0027s main method.\\n\\n`StudentsystemApplication`: This is the main class for the Spring Boot application, which is annotated with `@SpringBootApplication` to enable auto-configuration and component scanning.\\n\\n`main(String[] args)`: This is the main method that is executed when the application is started. It calls the `SpringApplication.run()` method to start the Spring Boot application.\",\"/studentfrontend/src/App.css\":\"This file appears to be a CSS stylesheet for a React application. It defines the styles for various elements of the application, including the main app container, the app logo, and the header. There are no functions defined in this file, only CSS classes. Here\\u0027s a summary of each class:\\n\\n`.App`: The main container for the application, with text-aligned center.\\n\\n`.App-logo`: The application\\u0027s logo, with a spinning animation when the user\\u0027s device prefers no reduced motion.\\n\\n`.App-header`: The header of the application, with a dark background, centered content, and a white font color.\\n\\n`.App-link`: A link within the application, with a blue color.\\n\\n`@keyframes App-logo-spin`: An animation that rotates the app logo 360 degrees over 20 seconds.\\n\\nOverall, this file sets the visual styles for the React application, including the layout, colors, and animations.\",\"/chat/src/main/java/com/canama/websocket/chat/controller/ChatController.java\":\"This file contains a Spring Boot controller class for a WebSocket-based chat application.\\n\\n`ChatController`: This class handles the WebSocket communication for the chat application.\\n\\n`recivePublicMessage`: This function receives a public message from a client and broadcasts it to all connected clients in the public chat room.\\n\\n`recivePrivateMessage`: This function receives a private message from a client and sends it to the intended recipient.\",\"/studentsystem/src/main/java/com/canama/studentsystem/controller/CourseController.java\":\"This file contains a Spring Boot REST controller called `CourseController` that handles the management of courses and their associated students in a student system.\\n\\n`CourseController`: A REST controller that provides endpoints for creating, retrieving, updating, and deleting courses, as well as adding and removing students from courses.\\n\\n`addCourse(Course course)`: Adds a new course to the system.\\n`getAllCourses()`: Retrieves a list of all courses.\\n`deleteCourse(Integer id)`: Deletes a course by its ID, if it has no students enrolled.\\n`addStudentToCourse(Integer courseId, Integer studentId)`: Adds a student to a course.\\n`updateStudentCourse(Integer courseId, Integer studentId)`: Updates a student\\u0027s course assignment by removing them from their current courses and assigning them to a new course.\",\"/studentfrontend/public/index.html\":\"This file is a standard HTML template for a React application. It does not contain any classes or functions. Instead, it sets up the basic structure and metadata for a React application, including:\\n\\n- Defining the HTML document structure with `\\u003chtml\\u003e`, `\\u003chead\\u003e`, and `\\u003cbody\\u003e` tags.\\n- Specifying the character encoding, viewport, and theme color for the application.\\n- Providing metadata about the application, such as the description and icons for mobile devices.\\n- Linking to the `manifest.json` file, which provides additional metadata for the application.\\n- Rendering the React application\\u0027s root element with `\\u003cdiv id\\u003d\\\"root\\\"\\u003e\\u003c/div\\u003e`.\\n- Providing instructions for running the development server and creating a production build.\\n\\nOverall, this file sets the stage for the React application to be built and deployed.\",\"/chat/src/main/java/com/canama/websocket/chat/model/Message.java\":\"This file defines a `Message` class, which represents a message in a chat application. The class has the following properties:\\n\\n`Message`: A class that represents a message in a chat application, with properties for the sender\\u0027s name, receiver\\u0027s name, message text, date, and status.\\n\\nThe file does not contain any functions, only the definition of the `Message` class.\",\"/studentfrontend/README.md\":\"This file is a documentation for the Create React App project, which is a popular tool for setting up a React development environment. It provides an overview of the available scripts and their functionalities, as well as information about code splitting, bundle size analysis, progressive web app development, advanced configuration, deployment, and troubleshooting. The file does not contain any classes or functions, but rather serves as a guide for developers who are getting started with Create React App.\",\"/studentsystem/src/main/java/com/canama/studentsystem/SwaggerConfig.java\":\"This file is a Spring Boot configuration class that sets up CORS (Cross-Origin Resource Sharing) settings for the application.\\n\\n`SwaggerConfig`: This class configures the CORS settings for the application, allowing access from specific origins and HTTP methods.\\n\\n`corsConfigurer()`: This method configures the CORS settings, including allowing access from specific origins, HTTP methods, and headers, as well as allowing credentials.\",\"/studentsystem/src/test/java/com/canama/studentsystem/StudentsystemApplicationTests.java\":\"This file is a test class for the `StudentsystemApplication` class in the `com.canama.studentsystem` package. It is a Spring Boot test that loads the application context to ensure that the application can be started successfully.\\n\\n`StudentsystemApplicationTests`: This class is a test class for the `StudentsystemApplication` class, which is the main application class for the student system.\\n\\n`contextLoads()`: This method is a test method that checks if the application context can be loaded successfully.\",\"/studentfrontend/src/components/Student.js\":\"This file is a React component that manages a student management system. It allows users to add new students, view a list of students, and manage the courses associated with each student. Here are the names and summaries of the classes and functions in the file:\\n\\n`Student`: A React component that renders the student management interface.\\n\\n`fetchStudents`: Fetches the list of students from the backend server.\\n\\n`handleClick`: Adds a new student to the system and associates the selected courses with the student.\\n\\n`handleDelete`: Deletes a student from the system.\\n\\n`handleDeleteCourse`: Removes a course from a student\\u0027s list of associated courses.\\n\\n`handleAddCourse`: Adds a new course to a student\\u0027s list of associated courses.\\n\\n`handleUpdateStudentCourse`: Updates the list of courses associated with a student in the backend server.\",\"/chat/src/main/java/com/canama/websocket/chat/model/Status.java\":\"This file defines an enumeration called `Status` that represents the different types of messages that can be sent in a chat application. The enumeration has three values: `JOIN`, `MESSAGE`, and `LEAVE`, which correspond to the different types of messages that can be sent by a user in a chat application.\",\"/studentfrontend/src/setupTests.js\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. It is importing the `jest-dom` library, which adds custom Jest matchers for asserting on DOM nodes. This allows the developer to perform more specific and expressive assertions on DOM elements during testing, such as checking for the presence of certain text content.\",\"/studentsystem/src/main/java/com/canama/studentsystem/DTO/CourseDto.java\":\"This file contains a single class:\\n\\n`CourseDto`: A data transfer object (DTO) that represents a course, including its ID, name, description, and a list of students enrolled in the course.\\n\\nThis file does not contain any functions. It is a simple DTO class that is used to transfer data between different layers of the application, such as the controller and the service layer.\",\"/README.md\":\"This file appears to be a document describing a student management system built using React and Spring Boot. It does not contain any class or function definitions. The file provides a high-level overview of the project, indicating that it is a student management system implemented using React and Spring Boot technologies.\",\"/studentfrontend/src/App.js\":\"This file is a React application that uses the `react-router-dom` library to create a multi-page application with three different components: `Student`, `Course`, and `ChatRoom`. The `App` component serves as the main entry point for the application and renders the `AppBar` component and the appropriate component based on the current URL.\\n\\n`AppBar`: A component that displays a navigation bar at the top of the application.\\n\\n`Student`: A component that displays information about students.\\n\\n`Course`: A component that displays information about courses.\\n\\n`ChatRoom`: A component that displays a chat room interface.\\n\\n`App`: The main entry point for the application, which sets up the routing and renders the appropriate components based on the current URL.\",\"/studentfrontend/package.json\":\"This file appears to be a `package.json` file, which is a configuration file used in Node.js projects to manage dependencies, scripts, and other project-related settings. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather a list of dependencies and scripts that are used in the project.\\n\\nThe file describes a React.js project named \\\"studentfrontend\\\" with a version of \\\"0.1.0\\\". It lists the various dependencies used in the project, such as Material-UI, React Router, and WebSocket libraries. The file also includes scripts for starting, building, testing, and ejecting the project.\",\"/studentsystem/src/main/java/com/canama/studentsystem/service/StudentServiceImpl.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `StudentServiceImpl`, which implements the `StudentService` interface for managing student and course data. The class uses Spring\\u0027s Dependency Injection framework and Transactional management.\\n\\n`StudentServiceImpl`: Provides an implementation of the `StudentService` interface, handling the CRUD operations for students and their associated courses.\\n\\n`saveStudent`: Saves a student in the database, updating their courses if the student already exists.\\n`getAllStudents`: Retrieves a list of all students from the database.\\n`deleteStudentById`: Deletes a student from the database, removing their association with any courses.\\n`getStudentById`: Retrieves a student from the database by their ID.\\n`updateStudentCourses`: Updates the courses associated with an existing student, adding new courses and removing any that are no longer associated.\"}"}
